com.example.federico.wearableui.viewport

Interface IViewport

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContinuousViewport, Viewport

    public interface IViewport
    Interface that defines the behaviour of a Viewport.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addContent(DrawableContent toAdd)
      Adds the passed DrawableContent to the Viewport.

      Draws a circle on the Viewport based on the passed parameters.
      DrawableBitmap drawImage(int resId, Point where, int width, int height)
      Draws an image based on the specified parameters.
      DrawableLine drawLine(Point from, Point to, int color, int alpha, boolean fill)
      Draws a line on the Viewport based on the passed parameters.
      DrawablePoint drawPoint(Point point, int color, int alpha, boolean fill)
      Draws a point on the Viewport based on the passed parameters.
      DrawableRectangle drawRectangle(Point where, int width, int height, int color, int alpha, boolean fill)
      Draws a rectangle on the Viewport based on the passed parameters.
      DrawableText drawText(Point where, java.lang.String text, int size, int color, int alpha, boolean fill)
      Draws the passed text on the Viewport with the specified parameters.
      ICursor getCursor()
      Returns the Cursor for this Viewport.
      int getExtraHeight()
      Returns how much taller the Viewport is compared to the device's screen.
      int getExtraWidth()
      Returns how much wider the Viewport is compared to the device's screen.
      Viewport.FieldOfView getFOV()
      Returns the portion of the Viewport that is currently visible to the user.
      int getViewportHeight()
      Returns the height of the Viewport.
      int getViewportWidth()
      Returns the width of the Viewport.
      boolean isLocked()
      Returns wether or not the Viewport is locked.
      void lock()
      Locks the Viewport so that it can no longer be scrolled.
      boolean removeContent(DrawableContent toRemove)
      Remove the passed DrawableContent from the Viewport.
      void scrollAccordingly(float pitch, float yaw)
      Scrolls the Viewport by modifying the value of its margins based upon the angles passed as argument.
      void unlock()
      Unlocks the Viewport making it scrollable.

    • Method Detail

      • getFOV

        Viewport.FieldOfView getFOV()
        Returns the portion of the Viewport that is currently visible to the user.
        Returns:
        the Viewport.FieldOfView.

      • getCursor

        ICursor getCursor()
        Returns the Cursor for this Viewport.
        Returns:
        the Cursor for this Viewport.

      • getExtraWidth

        int getExtraWidth()
        Returns how much wider the Viewport is compared to the device's screen.
        Returns:
        how many pixels wider the Viewport is compared to the device's screen.

      • getExtraHeight

        int getExtraHeight()
        Returns how much taller the Viewport is compared to the device's screen.
        Returns:
        how many pixels taller the Viewport is compared to the device's screen.

      • getViewportWidth

        int getViewportWidth()
        Returns the width of the Viewport.
        Returns:
        the Viewport width in pixels.

      • getViewportHeight

        int getViewportHeight()
        Returns the height of the Viewport.
        Returns:
        the Viewport height in pixels.

      • isLocked

        boolean isLocked()
        Returns wether or not the Viewport is locked.
        Returns:
        true if the Viewport is locked, false otherwise.

      • drawText

        DrawableText drawText(Point where,
                      java.lang.String text,
                      int size,
                      int color,
                      int alpha,
                      boolean fill)
        Draws the passed text on the Viewport with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        where - the bottom left Point where the text has to be drawn (relative to the Viewport coordinates).
        text - a String of text.
        size - the size of the text to be drawn.
        color - an int representing a color with whom the text will be drawn.
        alpha - an alpha value for the text (from 0 to 255).
        fill - true if the text should be drawn with a fill style, false if it should be drawn with a stroke style.
        Returns:
        a DrawableText object representing what was drawn.

      • drawRectangle

        DrawableRectangle drawRectangle(Point where,
                                int width,
                                int height,
                                int color,
                                int alpha,
                                boolean fill)
        Draws a rectangle on the Viewport based on the passed parameters.
        Parameters:
        where - the bottom left Point where the rectangle should be drawn (relative to the Viewport coordinates).
        width - the width in pixels of the rectangle.
        height - the height in pixels of the rectangle.
        color - an int representing the color with whom the rectangle will be drawn.
        alpha - an alpha value for the rectangle (from 0 to 255).
        fill - true if the rectangle should be filled, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        a DrawableRectangle object representing what was drawn.

      • drawCircle

        DrawableCircle drawCircle(Point where,
                          int radius,
                          int color,
                          int alpha,
                          boolean fill)
        Draws a circle on the Viewport based on the passed parameters.
        Parameters:
        where - the bottom left Point where the circle should be drawn (relative to the Viewport coordinates).
        radius - a length in pixels for the radius.
        color - an int representing the color with whom the circle will be drawn.
        alpha - an alpha value for the circle (from 0 to 255).
        fill - true if the circle should be filled, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        a DrawableCircle object representing what was drawn.

      • drawLine

        DrawableLine drawLine(Point from,
                      Point to,
                      int color,
                      int alpha,
                      boolean fill)
        Draws a line on the Viewport based on the passed parameters.
        Parameters:
        from - the starting Point of the line (relative to the Viewport coordinates).
        to - the end Point of the line (relative to the Viewport coordinates).
        color - an int representing the color with whom the line will be drawn.
        alpha - an alpha value for the line (from 0 to 255).
        fill - true for a fill style, false for a stroke style.
        Returns:
        a DrawableLine object representing what was drawn.

      • drawPoint

        DrawablePoint drawPoint(Point point,
                        int color,
                        int alpha,
                        boolean fill)
        Draws a point on the Viewport based on the passed parameters.
        Parameters:
        point - a Point representing where the point should be drawn (relative to the Viewport coordinates).
        color - an int representing a color with whom the point will be drawn.
        alpha - an alpha value for the point (from 0 to 255).
        fill - true for a fill style, false for a stroke style.
        Returns:
        a DrawablePoint object representing what was drawn.

      • drawImage

        DrawableBitmap drawImage(int resId,
                         Point where,
                         int width,
                         int height)
        Draws an image based on the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        resId - the id for a drawable resource.
        where - the bottom left Point where the image should be drawn (relative to the Viewport coordinates).
        width - the width in pixels.
        height - the height in pixels.
        Returns:
        a DrawableBitmap object representing what was drawn.

      • addContent

        void addContent(DrawableContent toAdd)
        Adds the passed DrawableContent to the Viewport.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - the DrawableContent to be added.

      • removeContent

        boolean removeContent(DrawableContent toRemove)
        Remove the passed DrawableContent from the Viewport.
        Parameters:
        toRemove - the DrawableContent to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the DrawableContent was removed, false otherwise.

      • scrollAccordingly

        void scrollAccordingly(float pitch,
                       float yaw)
        Scrolls the Viewport by modifying the value of its margins based upon the angles passed as argument. A call to this method also refreshes the Viewport by forcing it to redraw itself.
        Parameters:
        pitch - the pitch angle in degrees of the Gaze from its calibration orientation. This will determine of how many pixels the topMargin of the Viewport will change (in other words, this will determine the magnitude of the scrolling along the y axis).
        yaw - the yaw angle in degrees of the Gaze from its calibration orientation. This will determine of how many pixels the leftMargin of the Viewport will change (in other words, this will determine the magnitude of the scrolling along the x axis).

      • lock

        void lock()
        Locks the Viewport so that it can no longer be scrolled.

      • unlock

        void unlock()
        Unlocks the Viewport making it scrollable.
